channel.title: The best application you've ever used
channel.description:
What is the best application you've ever used? It can be any program, any platform.
Personally, I would choose the VLC media player. It can play nearly EVER video format ever made and they've done such a wonderful job in keeping it up-to-date.

item.title: The best application you've ever used
item.dc:creator: @antiyou antiyou
item.description:
@antiyou wrote:

Steam is truly a pile of shit.

Read full topic

item.title: The best application you've ever used
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:31, topic:408636”]Don’t have those problems. Games launch in a few seconds, the only problem I have is that it sometimes takes 20 - 30 seconds to open steam itself from a fresh boot. But that is hardly that bad.[/quote]The irony is, IntelliJ IDEA boots faster for me than Steam.

item.title: The best application you've ever used
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:27, topic:408636”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=509918.msg3701815#msg3701815 date=1312780403]

[quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=509918.msg3700696#msg3700696 date=1312737833]
vlc, putty
[/quote]How could I forget PuTTY… probably the best Windows-Linux branch program ever (consider FTP programs where you upload stuff, etc). By far the #1 SSH client in the world…
[/quote]Steam (but it’s still a piece of shit).[/quote]When will Valve ever realize how much shit they’ve put into their client?

Read full topic

item.title: The best application you've ever used
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“mutex_, post:10, topic:408636”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=509918.msg3700696#msg3700696 date=1312737833]
vlc, putty
[/quote]How could I forget PuTTY… probably the best Windows-Linux branch program ever (consider FTP programs where you upload stuff, etc). By far the #1 SSH client in the world…[/quote]

Pretty sure OpenSSH would be the “#1” SSH client. At least ahead of PuTTY anyway…

I’d have to say Vim, IDEA, Traktor, maybe Steam (but it’s still a piece of shit).

Read full topic
